intro: Fimbristylis mycosa, commonly known as the hairy bristlegrass, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is a small, perennial herb that typically grows in wet or marshy habitats. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered spikes of pale green to brown flowers. It is native to parts of Asia, including India and Southeast Asia. Fimbristylis mycosa is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in both freshwater and brackish environments.
